cardinfo.CI: Bauhinia - Pink Bauhinia Tree/Pink Bauhinia Tree - Canopy.jpg

V: Usually grows into a tree but also flowers and fruits as a vine.  Leaf blades +/- orbicular, about 7-15 cm diam., petioles about 2.5-6 cm long. Stipules pubescent, about 0.6-1 cm long. Both the upper and lower surfaces of the leaf blades clothed in simple, erect, pale brown hairs. Leaf apex deeply retuse with a central bristle. Sepals fused to form a spathe about 15-20 mm long. Petals about 4-5 cm long, distinctly clawed. Stamens one, filament glabrous, about 25-50 mm long. Anther about 5-6 mm long. Staminodes nine. Style about 35 mm long.  Pods slightly inflated, not flat, about 16-24 x 2-2.5 cm. Pods explosively dehiscent, throwing seeds in all directions. Seeds flat, about 10-12 x 7-8 mm, about 10-20 per pod.
